Detailed Description

The most profiles of Bluetooth must be connect respectively disconnected and also support at least a disconnect operation. Controllers that relate to this kind of profiles are directly or indirectly derived from this class.
BtConnectionBasedController implements the connect and disconnect operations and provides an interface to query the connection state of a device to a particular profile.

Member Function Documentation

btapi_cb_funp_t * BtConnectionBasedController::GetCallbackFunctionPointers (   )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Return a pointer to the structure of function pointers for the callbacks.

When the APOXI Bluetooth is registered at the stack an unique user id is generated. This user id identifies the storage of a structure containing all possible callback function addresses. The storage is allocated by the Bluetooth stack and a pointer to this storate is returned at registration. This pointer is stored in the member variable m_callback_functions.
GetCallbackFunctionPointers enables the access to this member variable.

Returns:
A pointer to a btapi_cb_funp_f, which is a structure containing all the function pointers for all callback functions that are needed by the Bluetooth stack.

Implements BtController.

UINT8 BtConnectionBasedController::GetPriority (   )  const [virtual]
 

Return the startup priority for this controller.

GetPriority is needed to determine the startup sequence of the various constrollers by which the subsystem manager starts them.
The value 0xFF means that it is the most important controller and should be started first. The value 0x00 denotes the least important controller, that will be started at the end of the controller startup sequence.

Returns:
An UINT8 containing the priority of this controller that describes the point of time in the startup sequence, when to start it.

Reimplemented from SubSystem.

btapi_userid_t BtConnectionBasedController::GetUserId (   )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Return the user id of this contoller assigned to by the Bluetooth stack.

When the APOXI Bluetooth is registered at the Bluetooth stack an unique id is generated and returned by the Bluetooth stack. This id has to be used at each API call to let the Bluetooth stack determine which set of callback function pointers to use for the invocation of a notification callback.
The user id generated by the Bluetooth stack is for internal use only and so the application programme needs no possibility to access this id.

Returns:
A btapi_userid_t containing the user id assigned by the Bluetooth stack.

Implements BtController.

void BtConnectionBasedController::Init (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Controller initalization function.

Implements BtController.

virtual BOOLEAN BtConnectionBasedController::IsDeviceConnected (  const BtDevice &  device  )  const [protected, pure virtual]
 

Is the passed in device connected to this profile or not?

IsDeviceConnected is used by the BtService class to determine whether it's target is connected to it's profile or not.
IsDeviceConnected is defined as pure virtual because of the child classes of BtConnectionBasedController have two different implementations of the memory, where they store the to them connected devices. Profiles which can only be used exclusively the implemenation of the storage is a member variable. Profiles that allow more than one device being connected at the same time use the BtDeviceList to remember all the devices which are connected to that profile.

Parameters:
device A reference to a BtDevice containing the remoted device that should be tested whether it is connected to this profile or not.
Returns:
TRUE The passed in device is correct to this profile.
FALSE The passed in device is not correct to this profile.

Implemented in BtMultiConnectionController, and BtSingleConnectionController.
